summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of Dr. Ornalaono, a forensic psychologist at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC), conducted on September 6, 2019. She details her psychological evaluation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 24, 2019, after he was placed on suicide watch, her decision to step him down to psychological observation, and her reaction to his subsequent death.

persons.name: Ornalaono
persons.role: Forensic Psychologist, Lieutenant in U.S. Public Health Service
persons.context: A forensic psychologist at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC) who evaluated Jeffrey Epstein on suicide watch on July 24, 2019, and made the decision to step him down to psychological observation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being held at MCC, evaluated by Dr. Ornalaono on suicide watch. He is described as energetic, smiling, respectful, and adamantly denying suicidal ideation.

persons.name: Dr. [Redacted]
persons.context: A doctor with whom Dr. Ornalaono discussed her decision to step Epstein down from suicide watch to psychological observation.

persons.name: Associate Warden [Redacted]
persons.context: An associate warden at MCC who concurred with Dr. Ornalaono's determination to step Epstein down from suicide watch.

connections.description: Dr. Ornalaono was the forensic psychologist who conducted a psychological evaluation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein while he was on suicide watch.
Dr. Ornalaono discussed her clinical decision regarding Epstein's suicide watch status with this doctor.
Dr. Ornalaono discussed her clinical decision regarding Epstein's suicide watch status with the associate warden.

events.title: Epstein's Psychological Evaluation
events.description: Dr. Ornalaono evaluates inmate Jeffrey Epstein for approximately 30 minutes while he is on suicide watch. She finds him energetic, smiling, respectful, and adamantly denying suicidal ideation.

events.title: Decision to Step Down Epstein from Suicide Watch
events.description: Based on her evaluation, Dr. Ornalaono decides to step Epstein down from suicide watch to a less restrictive 'psychological observation' status, a decision concurred with by a doctor and an associate warden.

events.title: FBI Interview of Dr. Ornalaono
events.description: FBI Special Agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys interview Dr. Ornalaono regarding her evaluation of Jeffrey Epstein and the circumstances leading to his death.

locations: Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, NY NY
New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Dr. Ornalaono evaluated Jeffrey Epstein on suicide watch on July 24, 2019, and found him to be 'energetic, smiling, appropriate and appreciative' and 'adamantly' denying suicidal thoughts.
Ornalaono decided to step Epstein down from suicide watch to 'psychological observation,' a less restrictive status that allowed him hygiene products, novels, legal visits, and a shower.
This clinical decision was made with the concurrence of a doctor and an associate warden at MCC.
Epstein reportedly told Ornalaono he had 'no interest in killing myself' and that he 'had a wonderful life.'
Ornalaono expressed being upset about Epstein's death, describing it as a 'tragic' incident where 'you never want to lose a life.'
